sys_hub_action_type_definition.description:
Creates a new Autonomous Database backup for the specified database based on the provided request parameters.

Inputs :

  • Display Name - The user-friendly name for the backup. The name does not have to be unique.
  • Compartment ID - The OCID of the compartment of the Autonomous Database.
  • Database Backup ID - The OCID of the Autonomous Database backup.

Outputs :

  • Status - If the request is executed successfully, Status is set to "Success". If there is a failure, Status is set to "Error".
  • Error Message - Reason for error, along with code. Populated only when an error occurs.
  • Compartment ID - The OCID of the compartment of the Autonomous Database.
  • Database ID - The database OCID.
  • Data Storage Size in TBs - The quantity of data in the database, in terabytes.
  • Display Name - The user-friendly name for the backup. The name does not have to be unique.
  • Backup ID - The OCID of the Autonomous Database backup.
  • Is Automatic - Indicates whether the backup is user-initiated or automatic.
  • Is Restorable - Indicates whether the backup can be used to restore the associated Autonomous Database.
  • Lifecycle Details - Additional information about the current lifecycle state.
  • Lifecycle State - The current state of the backup.
  • Time Ended - The date and time the backup completed.
  • Time Started - The date and time the backup started.
  • Type - The type of backup.

Error Messages :

  • Bad Request.
  • Unauthorized.
  • Not Found.
  • Internal Server Error.

To use this action, the corresponding Oracle connection and credential must be created and associated with the Oracle Connection & Credential alias. Learn More

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.
sys_hub_action_type_definition.name: Create Database Backup
